2:
He brought me up out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay,
\q and he set my feet on a rock and made my steps secure.
3:
He has put a new song in my mouth, praise to our God.
\q Many will see it and honor him
\q and will trust in Yahweh.
\q
4:
Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust
\q and does not honor the proud or those who turn away from him to lies.
\q
5:
Many, Yahweh my God, are the wonderful deeds that you have done,
\q and your thoughts which are about us cannot be numbered;
\q if I declared and spoke of them,
\q they would be more than could be counted.
\q
9:
I have proclaimed good news of your righteousness in the great assembly;
\q Yahweh, you know that my lips have not kept back from doing this.
11:
Do not keep back your acts of mercy from me, Yahweh;
\q let your covenant faithfulness and your trustworthiness always preserve me.
13:
Be pleased, Yahweh, to rescue me;
\q hurry to help me, Yahweh.
14:
Let them be ashamed and completely disappointed
\q who pursue my life to take it away.
\q Let them be turned back and brought to dishonor,
\q those who delight in hurting me.
\q
15:
Let them be shocked because of their shame,
\q those who say to me, "Aha, aha!"
16:
But may all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you;
\q let everyone who loves your salvation say continually,
\q "May Yahweh be praised."
\q
40:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
\q
